revised_title: Time-Resolved Macromolecular Crystallography: Techniques and Challenges
tldr: This article discusses time-resolved crystallography, a technique that allows researchers to study dynamic processes in macromolecules. The author explains the principles, problems, and practice of time-resolved crystallography, focusing on the use of synchrotron X-ray sources and the challenges involved in detecting structural intermediates and analyzing data. The article also highlights recent developments and applications of time-resolved crystallography in studying protein dynamics and molecular mechanisms.
